data.title: Excellent
data.text: Whenever we come to see friends in SoCal we come here for dinner. Small with great ambiance, the food and service do not disappoint. I had a birthday dinner here with friends and James and Denise pushed out the boat. Thank you for a wonderful Birthay dinner. I would wholeheartedly recommend this as a place to dine.

data.title: Can't wait to return
data.text:
We have eaten at a lot of restaurants on this trip to California and this was our favourite. Owen's is in the quint downtown area of Chino and is in the building of a former bank built at the turn of the 20th century.  It was a warm summer night and we were out on the patio where a nice breeze kept us comfortable. 

 From the moment we entered the restaurant we had excellent service and friendly, attentive interaction with the staff.  Denise, one of the owners, greeted us when we arrived and took our orders promptly since she knew that we were going to the theatre.  The menu was explained with care and the staff was happy for us to share dishes.  

I have to say that the crispy fried Brussel sprouts were an outstanding appetizer.  They came with a lemon aioli sauce and Parmigiana Reggiano.  Most of us ordered the Angus rib eye steak although I had the beef filet. a; was cooked to perfection. Both dishes were served with  arugula, radish, turnip, potato and chiles.  The garnish/accompaniement looked nice but it was rather tasteless.  I am not certain but I think that the white balsamic vinegar might have been forgotten.

The New Zealand Venison looked delicious and the wild boar with octopus was enjoyed by my partner.  

We enjoyed meeting James the chef/owner when he came out to see how we were getting along with dinner.  All the servers were good at their jobs and very personable.  There were 8 of us and everyone was aware of our time constraints and made certain that we got to the theatre on time.

data.title: Surprisingly good for location.
data.text: Had dinner with friend there while visiting over weekend. Lovely decor and server was really nice. We both had the salmon with greens which was tasty but more like a salmon salad than expected. I had margarita which was just OK - grew up in SoCal and used to really good ones there. Live music was lovely. Recommended if you are in the area. Seems they are trying hard.

data.title: Innovative restaurant
data.text: The restaurant appears to be in an old partial building open to the outside but can be covered in inclement weather.  Tables have linens and upholstered chairs.  Nice décor.  There was a gentlemen playing acoustic guitar on Friday night.  All the staff, from the owner to the wait staff were all gracious and accommodating. Food was innovative & delicious.  As an example, the house salad came out in a large bowl with the dressing (which was delicious) in the bottom…romaine lettuce was laid out on a plank of flatbread across the top.  You break the flatbread & the lettuce drops down into the dressing.  Really neat!  I had the campfire salmon which came out sizzling on a hot rock under mixed greens.  Again, very innovative & delicious.  My husband had filet mignon which he said was the best he has ever had.  The truffle tart was a delicious dessert.  There was a good selection of wines too.	There is plenty of parking behind the restaurant in the courtyard.  We thought the entrance was on the street but it is through an alley if you park on the street.	Reservations are suggested; open Tuesday through Saturday for dinner only.	Prices are high.  We really enjoyed our anniversary meal & will definitely go back.

data.title: Great Great food.  Very nice experience
data.text: Atmostphere is nice.  Chief is the BEST ever.  A great place for a romantic meal with that someone special.

data.title: It's a gem!
data.text: Delicious food, great atmosphere, wonderful service.   Reservations are recommended.  Chef James is an amazing chef and very creative.  If you like to try traditional foods with a creative spin, you'll love Owen's Bistro.

data.title: Great anniversary dinner
data.text:
We celebrated our five year anniversary at Owen's bistro on a Friday night at 7 PM. We made reservations earlier in the week and it wasn't very crowded when we got there. Sat on the patio as most people do, it was very nice and they had string lights that lit up to create great ambience once it got dark. 

We had the following- 
- Garlic cheese bread and brussels sprouts as appetizers. Garlic cheese bread was simply bread with cheese and garlic but was very tasty. Brussels sprouts were to die for, I asked for the recipe but she said it was a secret

- Fillet mignon medallions and barbecue short ribs. Both were amazing, both meats were very tender and seasoned and cooked perfectly. 

We shared the warm soft chocolate cake with ice cream for dessert. When making the reservation we told them it was our anniversary, they had little decorations on the table when we arrived and served us a small bottle of split champagne during dessert. It was a nice touch.

Service was a tad bit slow, took about 2.5 hours for the whole experience. That was okay with us as we wanted to just sit and relax. They served wine and beer only, no mixed drinks. 

Everyone working there was extremely kind, courteous and professional. We would definitely return keeping in mind that it will be a long night. There was plenty more to try on the menu that we didn't have. 

There is a nice gentleman that plays guitar on the patio during dinner, if you want a quieter experience ask to be sat inside or away from him. It was nice where we were sitting in the middle.

data.title: A nice evening out for couples, but smaller families would enjoy
data.text: the service was prompt and upon arriving very nice experience.  Small restaurant family owned serving excellent meals. Food is American but higher end. Think of a French Bistro in America. Note:  Desserts are nice but not a large selection.  Parking is plentiful. Need to make reservations in advance to guarantee table Friday-Sunday.I would go back again

data.title: A true delicious gem
data.text: Definitely best dinning experience in Chino. The food was delicious and the ambiance was perfect. Please be aware space is limited so make reservations or be prepared to wait. Can't wait to go back.

data.title: A hidden gem
data.text: This is a small and quaint restaurant with the most amazing food.  The food is not only wonderful, but the presentation is remarkable.  Weekends have a guitarist and this is so nice.  I have and would recommend this to anyone who like intimate dining with wonderful food choices that you cannot just get anywhere.  It is a little pricey but well worth it.

data.title: A Dining Gem in Chino
data.text: What a pleasant surprise to be invited to experience Owen's Bistro. A business client did the honors and so a first-ever stop in Chino resulted in one of the best meals we've enjoyed in recent history (echoed by every member in our group of 5). From the evening's soup (7 pepper - obviously popular, as 3 of us ordered it but only 1 lucky winner got the last one at 7:00  pm) to sweet potato pasta, pork belly and turkey tenderloin, the chef really knows how to create a visual and tasty experience. Food took it's good time arriving, so if you're in a hurry this is not your ideal spot. Once it does, however, every bite will be memorable.

data.title: A treasure filled experience
data.text: Wonderful ambience inside w/ high ceilings & brick which was nice on an uncharacteristic cool Ca night - outside seating appeared comfortable w/ plenty of outdoor heaters in full dining area. Food was to rave for from crispy fried Brussels sprouts & beet home fries as appetizers - soup of day was a kale & black bean combination - great.  The entire' that was judged best at table was the chef's choice - grilled halibut - not a regular menu item but choose if you have the opportunity - otherwise the salmon is the fallback very good fish choice.  Other diners at table were very pleased w/ the tenderloin & gnocchi features. Wine list not lengthy but very adequate and reasonably priced. The wine from Sky Fall small winery in Columbia Valley was much enjoyed.

data.title: Delicious year after year
data.text: My husband and I visit here about once a year (it's a bit pricey-about $90+ for two people) for special occasions and it is always delicious!  This year was just as wonderful.  I love the patio with it's romantic setting and the service is always special.  The food is always changing and the chef is amazing.  This is a wonderful fine dining restaurant.

data.title: Over priced with poor service
data.text:
On entry greeting was nice but followed by what felt like digs from smiling hostess. (10/3 8pm reservation) ( was this wife of chef?  Wore black dress with cork heels blond hair). Weren't seated until 8:25. Soup brought out 15 min after order. Meal not served until 45 min after soup. I had to inquire about meal. Seemed excess waiters bumping into each other but not really serving customers. Waiters seemed disengaged.  The food was excellent. Over priced for skimpy portions. Husband made a sandwich when he got home. Over priced for skimpy portions. This was our first visit. 
Thank you with hopes of improvement. In review of Yelp reviews our comments are along the same trend.

data.title: WOW, WOW, WOW!!
data.text: I had the absolutely MOST fantastic medallions of filet mignon at Owen's Bistro!  My daughters took me there for a late birthday celebration and let's just say that it was definitely worth the wait!!   The rack of lamb was amazing, as were the stuffed peppers... And don't even get me started on the desserts... Danny was an outstanding server, and we will definitely be coming back again - SOON!!  The service is attentive but not obnoxious - and I just can't say enough about the food!   Treat yourself - you'll be glad you did!

data.title: Excellent Birthday Dinner
data.text: Wanting to take my best friend for 20 years and his wife to dinner we chose Owens based on our past experiences there. We were greeted warmly with a smile and immediately seated at a pre decorated birthday table (perfect!). We ordered appetizers and dinner which was delicious and fresh, just as good as our previous visit there. The chef/owner himself brought out our meals and checked to see if everything was to our satisfaction. Delicious Delicious Delicious Highly Recommended

data.title: Watch your statement
data.text: We checked our credit card statement and found that Owen's had overcharged us by $63 AFTER the bill was signed.

data.title: Just ok
data.text: This little restaurant could be great. The seating is horrible, with the tables in a covered outdoor patio, so close together you feel like you are sitting with the couple next to you.  The service is very slow, but the food is good. We have tried it twice, and unfortunately, the same situation both times.

data.title: This place is amazing.
data.text: When I think 5 star, I don't picture downtown Chino, but the amazing food, terrific service, great atmosphere and owners that really care about the food and experience you receive when you go to Owen's make it an amazing place to spend an evening.  We were there for NYE, and had a great time.  If you haven't been there, do yourself a favor and check it out. You won't regret it.

data.title: Great food in an unhurried atmosphere
data.text:
We took another couple to Owen's and the service was great. The food was all very good. Don't go here is you want a semi-fast food experience (i.e.,- Chilis, Applebees, Outback). 
If you are serious about spending some time with great friends in an unhurried atmosphere, this is the best choice. Great wine list and food prepared in a thoughtful manner, presented as it comes available by an attentive staff is what you'll find.
 The history of the area is preserved well and we had live music on a Saturday evening. Nice touch...
